org.jplot2d.axtick

Class DateTickCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jplot2d.axtick.TickCalculator
      • org.jplot2d.axtick.LongTickCalculator
        • org.jplot2d.axtick.DateTickCalculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RangeAdvisor

    public class DateTickCalculator
extends LongTickCalculator
implements RangeAdvisor
    A calculator to calculate tick values in milliseconds and date format.

      • calcValuesByTickNumber

        public void calcValuesByTickNumber(int tickNumber,
                          int minorTickNumber)
        Description copied from class: TickCalculator
        Calculate the tick values by the given tick number and minor ticks number. The minor ticks number is a proposed value, and may be different from the actual minor ticks number returned by TickCalculator.getMinorNumber().
        Specified by:
        calcValuesByTickNumber in class TickCalculator
        Parameters:
        tickNumber - the number of ticks
        minorTickNumber - the number of minor ticks. if the given number is TickCalculator.AUTO_MINOR_TICK_NUMBER, the tick number is automatically chosen.

      • getLabelFormat

        public java.lang.String getLabelFormat()
        Description copied from class: TickCalculator
        Returns a proper format string to format the labels on tick values returned by TickCalculator.getValues(). Some calculators can derive format from its internal status directly.
        Specified by:
        getLabelFormat in class TickCalculator

      • calcLabelTextFormat

        public java.text.Format calcLabelTextFormat(@Nonnull
                                   java.lang.Object canonicalValues)
        Description copied from class: TickCalculator
        Calculate a proper text format to format the labels on the given values. A calculator can just returns a text format and do not provide a format string (returns a empty string). If The returned text format is null, a proper format string must be provided.
        Specified by:
        calcLabelTextFormat in class TickCalculator
        Parameters:
        canonicalValues - the values to be formatted
        Returns:
        a text format object

      • calcLabelFormatString

        public java.lang.String calcLabelFormatString(@Nonnull
                                     java.lang.Object values)
        Description copied from class: TickCalculator
        Calculate a proper format string to format the labels on the given values. This method can returns null if TickCalculator.calcLabelTextFormat(java.lang.Object) returns a format object.
        Overrides:
        calcLabelFormatString in class LongTickCalculator
        Parameters:
        values - the values to be formatted
        Returns:
        a format string
